justification: Credential theft can lead to unauthorized access to user accounts, affecting a significant number of users. The methods for stealing credentials are well-known and can be executed with moderate effort.
recommendations: Implement multi-factor authentication.; Educate users on phishing attacks.; Use secure password policies.

justification: Session hijacking can allow attackers to impersonate users, impacting all users with active sessions. The attack can be executed with moderate complexity.
recommendations: Use secure cookies with HttpOnly and Secure flags.; Implement session timeout mechanisms.; Monitor for unusual session activity.

justification: If passwords are stored insecurely, they can be easily compromised, affecting all users. The attack is reproducible with common tools.
recommendations: Use strong hashing algorithms for password storage.; Implement password salting.; Regularly audit password storage practices.

justification: Brute force attacks can compromise user accounts if weak passwords are used. The attack is straightforward and can affect multiple users.
recommendations: Implement account lockout mechanisms after multiple failed attempts.; Encourage users to create strong passwords.; Use CAPTCHA to prevent automated attacks.

justification: Misconfigurations can lead to exposure of sensitive data, affecting all users. The attack can be easily reproduced if configurations are not properly managed.
recommendations: Regularly review and audit configurations.; Implement security best practices for configuration management.; Use automated tools to detect misconfigurations.

justification: XSS can allow attackers to execute scripts in the context of users' browsers, affecting all users. The attack is well-known and can be executed with moderate effort.
recommendations: Sanitize and validate user inputs.; Implement Content Security Policy (CSP).; Use frameworks that automatically escape XSS by design.

justification: Improper OAuth2 implementation can lead to unauthorized access to user accounts, affecting all users. The attack can be executed with moderate complexity.
recommendations: Follow best practices for OAuth2 implementation.; Regularly review and test OAuth2 flows.; Use libraries that are well-maintained and secure.
